title: what is the role of supports?
body:
if a troll support is picked and you are adc and the support is continually CSing the entire time does that not negatively impact on the adcs game ?  should the adc tolerate this ?  if the support abandons you on bot lane does that not negatively impact on the adcs game?  supports are there to aid the adc warding the black spots  on the map and pokeing the enemy support/adc.  


so in all accounts if an adc doesnt like what the support is doing he should just bite his tongue and say nothing because you get reported!  now that seems a bit much to me.  so what do you think!

replies.body:
The support's role in he most basic sense is to protect. Everyone does it differently, some use heals and shields while others use CC and sometimes even damage to stop people advancing on the the ADC/team.

+ Your question about CS is a good one. Supports still need gold, and before the addition of support items, supports would occasionally take a few CS for themselves. I believe this is still the case in DotA and many other MOBAs. Riot made this easier though, by adding support items, that gave supports a form of income without stealing CS from the ADC, to avoid any misunderstanding and fighting.

 _Does that mean taking CS from the ADC is not supportive?_

 No, it's just a different strategy. Infact a common LCS statergy, was to give the support level 2 from a jungle camp to increase their power in lane, at the expense of the ADC's CS. **The only reason we stick to a meta-game is because MOBAs like League are very complex, and having a meta is a good way to prevent misunderstanding in a low communication environment.**


+ NO! SUPPORTS ARE NOT HERE TO WARD!
Warding is one of our main tasks, but if there is a lack of wards, GO BUY ONE YOURSELF! It is everyone's job to maintain vision on the map, every player should buy at least 1 pink ward per game.

If a support is taking CS, make sure they aren't just new, and tell them that usually the ADC takes the CS in lane. You shouldn't be getting out CSed by a support anyway, you're the one with the AD runes and masteries.

Just wanted to clear up some meta-game and warding stuff before answering your question.

>  if the support abandons you on bot lane does that not negatively impact on the adcs game? 

Most good supports will frequently leave the ADC in order to put pressure elsewhere on the map. Negatively impacting the ADC slightly while gaining a huge advantage for other team members though ganks etc is more than worth it for your team overall. Come mid-game there's even more stuff to do on the map, and following the ADC around mindlessly is usually the mark of a bad support, not a good one.

A Support should SUPPORT you, it is not rocket science, really. Stop fucking taking CS, stop taking kills, stop being a turd muncher and actually support the person in lane.

Too many times I see the 'support' picked by someone like Talon, completely useless. I see plenty who just sit there and wait for a kill to happen so they can steal it, yes I have seen 'supports' with the lowest damage done, taken AND most kills, like when Kat goes support. I have seen WAY too many who just pick whatever because they didn't get the lane they wanted, they choose NO support items, don't even get a single ward, never do anything to help, just look out for themselves and only attack if they can either won't take damage or get an easy kill.

Really, you take someone with CC, heals, lane sustain, something that actually either supports you directly, indirectly, or disrupts the enemy. Annie support, MF support, those types CAN work, but someone like Blitz, Ali, Thresh, Voli and the like is much better, you can not only CC the enemy, but charge in like a dickhead and survive long enough for your team mate to get some damage done.

TL;DR - SUPPORT YOUR ADC YOU ****HEADS AND STOP PICKING SOME SHIT JUST BECAUSE YOU DIDN'T GET THE LANE YOU WANTED!

Yea they left in season 5.

While each player should try to work with their team instead of against it, and playing with the meta is the easiest way to accomplish that, playing outside the meta (like 2 carries in bot) is not a punishable offense. (unless they are intentionally trying to ruin your game)

Unfortunately, at the bottom of Bronze you're more likely to find people that are simply unaware of what the meta is; most likely this person is not intentionally playing Support "wrong", they just don't know how to play it "right".

You can try to explain to them the meta way to do it, but if they don't care there is nothing you can do. They will have a hard time climbing out of Bronze than you, and if you're good you can eventually climb out and not deal with them anymore (typically).
